page.title: 02RELIGION IN ALVA
page.content: The{cemetery}belonging to St.Serf's {church}is on the hill at the east end of Alva. Some of the graves are more than 200 years old. St.Serf's church was destroyed by a fire in 1984. The site has been levelled and grassed over. There is a Mausoleum where the Johnstones were buried,designed by Robert Adam in 1790. The bell belonging to St.Serf's church was supposed to have a{curse}on it,that if anyone took down the bell they would come to some harm,but it was removed by the Royal Scots for their garrison church. The churches in Alva now are the Catholic church of St.John Vianney,the Baptist church and the Eadie Kirk.
